As you know,

my book The Origin of Species consists of

15 chapters. Here I briefly explain each one.

Chapter 1 introduces Variation Under Domestication. When living things are

placed in a novel environment,

variations occur over generations.

For example, compared to wild ducks,

ducks raised domestically have lighter wing bones and heavier leg bones because domesticated ducks have flown less and walked much more than wild ducks.

184
